title: TTB No.8
description: Infer which of two alternatives has the higher value by (a) searching through cues in order of validity, (b) stopping the search as soon as a cue discrateiminates, (c) choosing the alternative this cue favors. Can predict as accurately as or more than multiple regression, neural networks, exemplar models, and classification and regression trees.

title: My Minimalist Title
description: Draw a cue randomly (without replacement) and look up the cue values of the two objects. If one object has a positive cue value and the other does not, then stop search. Predict that the object with the positive cue value has the higher value on the criterion.

title: My Weighted Tallying
description: Weighted tallying of postive evidence is identical with tallying, except that it weights each cue according to its ecological validity.

title: My Tallying Title
description: In this algorithm, the number of positive cue values for each object is tallied across all cues (i = 1,..., n), and the object with the largest number of positive cue values is chosen. To estimate a criterion, do not estimate weights but simply count the number of favoring cues.
